4073     
4074     static IRAtom* uwiden_to_host_word ( PCEnv* pce, IRAtom* a )
4075     {
4076        IRType a_ty = typeOfIRExpr(pce->sb->tyenv, a);
4077        tl_assert(isIRAtom(a));
4078        if (pce->hWordTy == Ity_I32) {
4079           switch (a_ty) {
4080              case Ity_I8:
4081                 return assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32, unop(Iop_8Uto32, a) );
4082              case Ity_I16:
4083                 return assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32, unop(Iop_16Uto32, a) );
4084              default:
4085                 ppIRType(a_ty);
4086                 tl_assert(0);
4087           }
4088        } else {
4089           tl_assert(pce->hWordTy == Ity_I64);
4090           switch (a_ty) {
4091              case Ity_I8:
4092                 return assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64, unop(Iop_8Uto64, a) );
4093              case Ity_I16:
4094                 return assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64, unop(Iop_16Uto64, a) );
4095              case Ity_I32:
4096                 return assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64, unop(Iop_32Uto64, a) );
4097              default:
4098                 ppIRType(a_ty);
4099                 tl_assert(0);
4100           }
4101        }
4102     }
4103     
4104     /* 'e' is a word-sized atom.  Call nonptr_or_unknown with it, bind the
4105        results to a new temporary, and return the temporary.  Note this
4106        takes an original expression but returns a shadow value. */
4107     static IRTemp gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w ( PCEnv* pce, IRExpr* e )
4108     {
4109        return gen_dirty_W_W( pce, &nonptr_or_unknown, 
4110                                   "nonptr_or_unknown", e );
4111     }
4112     
4113     
4114     /* Generate the shadow value for an IRExpr which is an atom and
4115        guaranteed to be word-sized. */
4116     static IRAtom* schemeEw_Atom ( PCEnv* pce, IRExpr* e )
4117     {
4118        if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32) {
4119           if (e->tag == Iex_Const && e->Iex.Const.con->tag == Ico_U32) {
4120              IRTemp t;
4121              tl_assert(sizeof(UWord) == 4);
4122              t = gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w(pce, e);
4123              return mkexpr(t);
4124           }
4125           if (e->tag == Iex_RdTmp
4126               && typeOfIRExpr(pce->sb->tyenv, e) == Ity_I32) {
4127              return mkexpr( findShadowTmp(pce, e->Iex.RdTmp.tmp) );
4128           }
4129           /* there are no other word-sized atom cases */
4130        } else {
4131           if (e->tag == Iex_Const && e->Iex.Const.con->tag == Ico_U64) {
4132              IRTemp t;
4133              tl_assert(sizeof(UWord) == 8);
4134              //return mkU64( (ULong)(UWord)NONPTR );
4135              t = gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w(pce, e);
4136              return mkexpr(t);
4137           }
4138           if (e->tag == Iex_RdTmp
4139               && typeOfIRExpr(pce->sb->tyenv, e) == Ity_I64) {
4140              return mkexpr( findShadowTmp(pce, e->Iex.RdTmp.tmp) );
4141           }
4142           /* there are no other word-sized atom cases */
4143        }
4144        ppIRExpr(e);
4145        tl_assert(0);
4146     }
4147     
4148     
4149     static
4150     void instrument_arithop ( PCEnv* pce,
4151                               IRTemp dst, /* already holds result */
4152                               IRTemp dstv, /* generate an assignment to this */
4153                               IROp op,
4154                               /* original args, guaranteed to be atoms */
4155                               IRExpr* a1, IRExpr* a2, IRExpr* a3, IRExpr* a4 )
4156     {
4157        HChar*  nm  = NULL;
4158        void*   fn  = NULL;
4159        IRExpr* a1v = NULL;
4160        IRExpr* a2v = NULL;
4161        //IRExpr* a3v = NULL;
4162        //IRExpr* a4v = NULL;
4163        IRTemp  res = IRTemp_INVALID;
4164     
4165        if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32) {
4166     
4167           tl_assert(pce->hWordTy == Ity_I32);
4168           switch (op) {
4169     
4170              /* For these cases, pass Segs for both arguments, and the
4171                 result value. */
4172              case Iop_Add32: nm = "do_addW"; fn = &do_addW; goto ssr32;
4173              case Iop_Sub32: nm = "do_subW"; fn = &do_subW; goto ssr32;
4174              case Iop_Or32:  nm = "do_orW";  fn = &do_orW;  goto ssr32;
4175              ssr32:
4176                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4177                 a2v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a2 );
4178                 res = gen_dirty_W_WWW( pce, fn, nm, a1v, a2v, mkexpr(dst) );
4179                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4180                 break;
4181     
4182              /* In this case, pass Segs for both arguments, the result
4183                 value, and the difference between the (original) values of
4184                 the arguments. */
4185              case Iop_And32:
4186                 nm = "do_andW"; fn = &do_andW;
4187                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4188                 a2v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a2 );
4189                 res = gen_dirty_W_WWWW( 
4190                          pce, fn, nm, a1v, a2v, mkexpr(dst),
4191                          assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4192                                     binop(Iop_Sub32,a1,a2) ) );
4193                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4194                 break;
4195     
4196              /* Pass one shadow arg and the result to the helper. */
4197              case Iop_Not32: nm = "do_notW"; fn = &do_notW; goto vr32;
4198              vr32:
4199                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4200                 res = gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, fn, nm, a1v, mkexpr(dst) );
4201                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4202                 break;
4203     
4204              /* Pass two shadow args only to the helper. */
4205              case Iop_Mul32: nm = "do_mulW"; fn = &do_mulW; goto vv32;
4206              vv32:
4207                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4208                 a2v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a2 );
4209                 res = gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, fn, nm, a1v, a2v );
4210                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4211                 break;
4212     
4213              /* We don't really know what the result could be; test at run
4214                 time. */
4215              case Iop_64HIto32: goto n_or_u_32;
4216              case Iop_64to32:   goto n_or_u_32;
4217              case Iop_Xor32:    goto n_or_u_32;
4218              n_or_u_32:
4219                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv,
4220                         mkexpr(
4221                            gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w( pce, 
4222                                                          mkexpr(dst) ) ) );
4223                 break;
4224     
4225              /* Cases where it's very obvious that the result cannot be a
4226                 pointer.  Hence declare directly that it's NONPTR; don't
4227                 bother with the overhead of calling nonptr_or_unknown. */
4228     
4229              /* cases where it makes no sense for the result to be a ptr */
4230              /* FIXME: for Shl/Shr/Sar, really should do a test on the 2nd
4231                 arg, so that shift by zero preserves the original
4232                 value. */
4233              case Iop_Shl32:     goto n32;
4234              case Iop_Sar32:     goto n32;
4235              case Iop_Shr32:     goto n32;
4236              case Iop_16Uto32:   goto n32;
4237              case Iop_16Sto32:   goto n32;
4238              case Iop_F64toI32S: goto n32;
4239              case Iop_16HLto32:  goto n32;
4240              case Iop_MullS16:   goto n32;
4241              case Iop_MullU16:   goto n32;
4242              case Iop_PRemC3210F64: goto n32;
4243              case Iop_DivU32:    goto n32;
4244              case Iop_DivS32:    goto n32;
4245              case Iop_V128to32:  goto n32;
4246     
4247              /* cases where result range is very limited and clearly cannot
4248                 be a pointer */
4249              case Iop_1Uto32: goto n32;
4250              case Iop_1Sto32: goto n32;
4251              case Iop_8Uto32: goto n32;
4252              case Iop_8Sto32: goto n32;
4253              case Iop_Clz32:  goto n32;
4254              case Iop_Ctz32:  goto n32;
4255              case Iop_CmpF64: goto n32;
4256              case Iop_CmpORD32S: goto n32;
4257              case Iop_CmpORD32U: goto n32;
4258              n32:
4259                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkU32( (UWord)NONPTR ));
4260                 break;
4261     
4262              default:
4263                 VG_(printf)("instrument_arithop(32-bit): unhandled: ");
4264                 ppIROp(op);
4265                 tl_assert(0);
4266           }
4267     
4268        } else {
4269     
4270           tl_assert(pce->gWordTy == Ity_I64);
4271           switch (op) {
4272     
4273              /* For these cases, pass Segs for both arguments, and the
4274                 result value. */
4275              case Iop_Add64: nm = "do_addW"; fn = &do_addW; goto ssr64;
4276              case Iop_Sub64: nm = "do_subW"; fn = &do_subW; goto ssr64;
4277              case Iop_Or64:  nm = "do_orW";  fn = &do_orW;  goto ssr64;
4278              ssr64:
4279                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4280                 a2v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a2 );
4281                 res = gen_dirty_W_WWW( pce, fn, nm, a1v, a2v, mkexpr(dst) );
4282                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4283                 break;
4284     
4285              /* In this case, pass Segs for both arguments, the result
4286                 value, and the difference between the (original) values of
4287                 the arguments. */
4288              case Iop_And64:
4289                 nm = "do_andW"; fn = &do_andW;
4290                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4291                 a2v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a2 );
4292                 res = gen_dirty_W_WWWW( 
4293                          pce, fn, nm, a1v, a2v, mkexpr(dst),
4294                          assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64,
4295                                     binop(Iop_Sub64,a1,a2) ) );
4296                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4297                 break;
4298     
4299              /* Pass one shadow arg and the result to the helper. */
4300              case Iop_Not64: nm = "do_notW"; fn = &do_notW; goto vr64;
4301              vr64:
4302                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4303                 res = gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, fn, nm, a1v, mkexpr(dst) );
4304                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4305                 break;
4306     
4307              /* Pass two shadow args only to the helper. */
4308              case Iop_Mul64: nm = "do_mulW"; fn = &do_mulW; goto vv64;
4309              vv64:
4310                 a1v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a1 );
4311                 a2v = schemeEw_Atom( pce, a2 );
4312                 res = gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, fn, nm, a1v, a2v );
4313                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkexpr(res) );
4314                 break;
4315     
4316              /* We don't really know what the result could be; test at run
4317                 time. */
4318              case Iop_Xor64:      goto n_or_u_64;
4319              case Iop_128HIto64:  goto n_or_u_64;
4320              case Iop_128to64:    goto n_or_u_64;
4321              case Iop_V128HIto64: goto n_or_u_64;
4322              case Iop_V128to64:   goto n_or_u_64;
4323              n_or_u_64:
4324                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv,
4325                         mkexpr(
4326                            gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w( pce, 
4327                                                          mkexpr(dst) ) ) );
4328                 break;
4329     
4330              /* Cases where it's very obvious that the result cannot be a
4331                 pointer.  Hence declare directly that it's NONPTR; don't
4332                 bother with the overhead of calling nonptr_or_unknown. */
4333     
4334              /* cases where it makes no sense for the result to be a ptr */
4335              /* FIXME: for Shl/Shr/Sar, really should do a test on the 2nd
4336                 arg, so that shift by zero preserves the original
4337                 value. */
4338              case Iop_Shl64:      goto n64;
4339              case Iop_Sar64:      goto n64;
4340              case Iop_Shr64:      goto n64;
4341              case Iop_32Uto64:    goto n64;
4342              case Iop_32Sto64:    goto n64;
4343              case Iop_16Uto64:    goto n64;
4344              case Iop_16Sto64:    goto n64;
4345              case Iop_32HLto64:   goto n64;
4346              case Iop_DivModU64to32: goto n64;
4347              case Iop_DivModS64to32: goto n64;
4348              case Iop_F64toI64S:     goto n64;
4349              case Iop_MullS32:    goto n64;
4350              case Iop_MullU32:    goto n64;
4351              case Iop_DivU64:     goto n64;
4352              case Iop_DivS64:     goto n64;
4353              case Iop_ReinterpF64asI64: goto n64;
4354     
4355              /* cases where result range is very limited and clearly cannot
4356                 be a pointer */
4357              case Iop_1Uto64:        goto n64;
4358              case Iop_8Uto64:        goto n64;
4359              case Iop_8Sto64:        goto n64;
4360              case Iop_Ctz64:         goto n64;
4361              case Iop_Clz64:         goto n64;
4362              case Iop_CmpORD64S:     goto n64;
4363              case Iop_CmpORD64U:     goto n64;
4364              /* 64-bit simd */
4365              case Iop_Avg8Ux8: case Iop_Avg16Ux4:
4366              case Iop_Max16Sx4: case Iop_Max8Ux8: case Iop_Min16Sx4:
4367              case Iop_Min8Ux8: case Iop_MulHi16Ux4:
4368              case Iop_QNarrow32Sx2: case Iop_QNarrow16Sx4:
4369              case Iop_QNarrow16Ux4: case Iop_Add8x8: case Iop_Add32x2:
4370              case Iop_QAdd8Sx8: case Iop_QAdd16Sx4: case Iop_QAdd8Ux8:
4371              case Iop_QAdd16Ux4: case Iop_Add16x4: case Iop_CmpEQ8x8:
4372              case Iop_CmpEQ32x2: case Iop_CmpEQ16x4: case Iop_CmpGT8Sx8:
4373              case Iop_CmpGT32Sx2: case Iop_CmpGT16Sx4: case Iop_MulHi16Sx4:
4374              case Iop_Mul16x4: case Iop_ShlN32x2: case Iop_ShlN16x4:
4375              case Iop_SarN32x2: case Iop_SarN16x4: case Iop_ShrN32x2: case Iop_ShrN8x8:
4376              case Iop_ShrN16x4: case Iop_Sub8x8: case Iop_Sub32x2:
4377              case Iop_QSub8Sx8: case Iop_QSub16Sx4: case Iop_QSub8Ux8:
4378              case Iop_QSub16Ux4: case Iop_Sub16x4: case Iop_InterleaveHI8x8:
4379              case Iop_InterleaveHI32x2: case Iop_InterleaveHI16x4:
4380              case Iop_InterleaveLO8x8: case Iop_InterleaveLO32x2:
4381              case Iop_InterleaveLO16x4: case Iop_SarN8x8:
4382              case Iop_Perm8x8: case Iop_ShlN8x8: case Iop_Mul32x2:
4383              case Iop_CatEvenLanes16x4: case Iop_CatOddLanes16x4:
4384              n64:
4385                 assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkU64( (UWord)NONPTR ));
4386                 break;
4387     
4388              default:
4389                 VG_(printf)("instrument_arithop(64-bit): unhandled: ");
4390                 ppIROp(op);
4391                 tl_assert(0);
4392           }
4393        }
4394     }
4395     
4396     static 
4397     void gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_range ( PCEnv* pce,
4398                                             IRExpr* guard,
4399                                             IRAtom* addr, IRAtom* len )
4400     {
4401        gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, guard,
4402                        &nonptr_or_unknown_range,
4403                        "nonptr_or_unknown_range",
4404                        addr, len );
4405     }
4406     
4407     /* iii describes zero or more non-exact integer register updates.  For
4408        each one, generate IR to get the containing register, apply
4409        nonptr_or_unknown to it, and write it back again. */
4410     static void gen_nonptr_or_unknown_for_III( PCEnv* pce, IntRegInfo* iii )
4411     {
4412        Int i;
4413        tl_assert(iii && iii->n_offsets >= 0);
4414        for (i = 0; i < iii->n_offsets; i++) {
4415           IRAtom* a1 = assignNew( 'I', pce, pce->gWordTy, 
4416                                   IRExpr_Get( iii->offsets[i], pce->gWordTy ));
4417           IRTemp a2 = gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w( pce, a1 );
4418           stmt( 'I', pce, IRStmt_Put( iii->offsets[i] 
4419                                          + pce->guest_state_sizeB,
4420                                       mkexpr(a2) ));
4421        }
4422     }
4423     
4424     
4425     /* schemeS helper for doing stores, pulled out into a function because
4426        it needs to handle both normal stores and store-conditionals.
4427        Returns False if we see a case we don't know how to handle.
4428     */
4429     static Bool schemeS_store ( PCEnv* pce,
4430                                 IRExpr* data, IRExpr* addr, IRTemp resSC )
4431     {
4432        /* We have: STle(addr) = data
4433           if data is int-word sized, do
4434           check_store4(addr, addr#, data, data#)
4435           for all other stores
4436           check_store{1,2}(addr, addr#, data)
4437     
4438           The helper actually *does* the store, so that it can do the
4439           post-hoc ugly hack of inspecting and "improving" the shadow data
4440           after the store, in the case where it isn't an aligned word
4441           store.
4442     
4443           Only word-sized values are shadowed.  If this is a
4444           store-conditional, .resSC will denote a non-word-typed temp, and
4445           so we don't need to shadow it.  Assert about the type, tho.
4446           However, since we're not re-emitting the original IRStmt_Store,
4447           but rather doing it as part of the helper function, we need to
4448           actually do a SC in the helper, and assign the result bit to
4449           .resSC.  Ugly.
4450        */
4451        IRType  d_ty  = typeOfIRExpr(pce->sb->tyenv, data);
4452        IRExpr* addrv = schemeEw_Atom( pce, addr );
4453        if (resSC != IRTemp_INVALID) {
4454           tl_assert(typeOfIRTemp(pce->sb->tyenv, resSC) == Ity_I1);
4455           /* viz, not something we want to shadow */
4456           /* also, throw out all store-conditional cases that
4457              we can't handle */
4458           if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32 && d_ty != Ity_I32)
4459              return False;
4460           if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I64 && d_ty != Ity_I32 && d_ty != Ity_I64)
4461              return False;
4462        }
4463        if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32) {
4464           /* ------ 32 bit host/guest (cough, cough) ------ */
4465           switch (d_ty) {
4466              /* Integer word case */
4467              case Ity_I32: {
4468                 IRExpr* datav = schemeEw_Atom( pce, data );
4469                 if (resSC == IRTemp_INVALID) {
4470                    /* "normal" store */
4471                    gen_dirty_v_WWWW( pce,
4472                                      &check_store4_P, "check_store4_P",
4473                                      addr, addrv, data, datav );
4474                 } else {
4475                    /* store-conditional; need to snarf the success bit */
4476                    IRTemp resSC32
4477                        = gen_dirty_W_WWWW( pce,
4478                                            &check_store4C_P,
4479                                            "check_store4C_P",
4480                                            addr, addrv, data, datav );
4481                    /* presumably resSC32 will really be Ity_I32.  In
4482                       any case we'll get jumped by the IR sanity
4483                       checker if it's not, when it sees the
4484                       following statement. */
4485                    assign( 'I', pce, resSC, unop(Iop_32to1, mkexpr(resSC32)) );
4486                 }
4487                 break;
4488              }
4489              /* Integer subword cases */
4490              case Ity_I16:
4491                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4492                                  &check_store2, "check_store2",
4493                                  addr, addrv,
4494                                  uwiden_to_host_word( pce, data ));
4495                 break;
4496              case Ity_I8:
4497                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4498                                  &check_store1, "check_store1",
4499                                  addr, addrv,
4500                                  uwiden_to_host_word( pce, data ));
4501                 break;
4502              /* 64-bit float.  Pass store data in 2 32-bit pieces. */
4503              case Ity_F64: {
4504                 IRAtom* d64 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64,
4505                                          unop(Iop_ReinterpF64asI64, data) );
4506                 IRAtom* dLo32 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4507                                            unop(Iop_64to32, d64) );
4508                 IRAtom* dHi32 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4509                                            unop(Iop_64HIto32, d64) );
4510                 gen_dirty_v_WWWW( pce,
4511                                   &check_store8_ms4B_ls4B, 
4512                                   "check_store8_ms4B_ls4B",
4513                                   addr, addrv, dHi32, dLo32 );
4514                 break;
4515              }
4516              /* 32-bit float.  We can just use _store4, but need
4517                 to futz with the argument type. */
4518              case Ity_F32: {
4519                 IRAtom* i32 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32, 
4520                                          unop(Iop_ReinterpF32asI32,
4521                                               data ) );
4522                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4523                                  &check_store4,
4524                                  "check_store4",
4525                                  addr, addrv, i32 );
4526                 break;
4527              }
4528              /* 64-bit int.  Pass store data in 2 32-bit pieces. */
4529              case Ity_I64: {
4530                 IRAtom* dLo32 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4531                                            unop(Iop_64to32, data) );
4532                 IRAtom* dHi32 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4533                                            unop(Iop_64HIto32, data) );
4534                 gen_dirty_v_WWWW( pce,
4535                                   &check_store8_ms4B_ls4B, 
4536                                   "check_store8_ms4B_ls4B",
4537                                   addr, addrv, dHi32, dLo32 );
4538                 break;
4539              }
4540              /* 128-bit vector.  Pass store data in 4 32-bit pieces.
4541                 This is all very ugly and inefficient, but it is
4542                 hard to better without considerably complicating the
4543                 store-handling schemes. */
4544              case Ity_V128: {
4545                 IRAtom* dHi64 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64,
4546                                            unop(Iop_V128HIto64, data) );
4547                 IRAtom* dLo64 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64,
4548                                            unop(Iop_V128to64, data) );
4549                 IRAtom* w3    = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4550                                            unop(Iop_64HIto32, dHi64) );
4551                 IRAtom* w2    = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4552                                            unop(Iop_64to32, dHi64) );
4553                 IRAtom* w1    = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4554                                            unop(Iop_64HIto32, dLo64) );
4555                 IRAtom* w0    = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32,
4556                                            unop(Iop_64to32, dLo64) );
4557                 gen_dirty_v_6W( pce,
4558                                 &check_store16_ms4B_4B_4B_ls4B, 
4559                                 "check_store16_ms4B_4B_4B_ls4B",
4560                                 addr, addrv, w3, w2, w1, w0 );
4561                 break;
4562              }
4563              default:
4564                 ppIRType(d_ty); tl_assert(0);
4565           }
4566        } else {
4567           /* ------ 64 bit host/guest (cough, cough) ------ */
4568           switch (d_ty) {
4569              /* Integer word case */
4570              case Ity_I64: {
4571                 IRExpr* datav = schemeEw_Atom( pce, data );
4572                 if (resSC == IRTemp_INVALID) {
4573                    /* "normal" store */
4574                    gen_dirty_v_WWWW( pce,
4575                                      &check_store8_P, "check_store8_P",
4576                                      addr, addrv, data, datav );
4577                 } else {
4578                    IRTemp resSC64
4579                        = gen_dirty_W_WWWW( pce,
4580                                            &check_store8C_P,
4581                                            "check_store8C_P",
4582                                            addr, addrv, data, datav );
4583                    assign( 'I', pce, resSC, unop(Iop_64to1, mkexpr(resSC64)) );
4584                 }
4585                 break;
4586              }
4587              /* Integer subword cases */
4588              case Ity_I32:
4589                 if (resSC == IRTemp_INVALID) {
4590                    /* "normal" store */
4591                    gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4592                                     &check_store4, "check_store4",
4593                                     addr, addrv,
4594                                     uwiden_to_host_word( pce, data ));
4595                 } else {
4596                    /* store-conditional; need to snarf the success bit */
4597                    IRTemp resSC64
4598                        = gen_dirty_W_WWW( pce,
4599                                           &check_store4C,
4600                                           "check_store4C",
4601                                           addr, addrv,
4602                                           uwiden_to_host_word( pce, data ));
4603                    assign( 'I', pce, resSC, unop(Iop_64to1, mkexpr(resSC64)) );
4604                 }
4605                 break;
4606              case Ity_I16:
4607                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4608                                  &check_store2, "check_store2",
4609                                  addr, addrv,
4610                                  uwiden_to_host_word( pce, data ));
4611                 break;
4612              case Ity_I8:
4613                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4614                                  &check_store1, "check_store1",
4615                                  addr, addrv,
4616                                  uwiden_to_host_word( pce, data ));
4617                 break;
4618              /* 128-bit vector.  Pass store data in 2 64-bit pieces. */
4619              case Ity_V128: {
4620                 IRAtom* dHi64 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64,
4621                                            unop(Iop_V128HIto64, data) );
4622                 IRAtom* dLo64 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64,
4623                                            unop(Iop_V128to64, data) );
4624                 gen_dirty_v_WWWW( pce,
4625                                   &check_store16_ms8B_ls8B, 
4626                                   "check_store16_ms8B_ls8B",
4627                                   addr, addrv, dHi64, dLo64 );
4628                 break;
4629              }
4630              /* 64-bit float. */
4631              case Ity_F64: {
4632                 IRAtom* dI = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64, 
4633                                          unop(Iop_ReinterpF64asI64,
4634                                               data ) );
4635                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4636                                  &check_store8_all8B,
4637                                  "check_store8_all8B",
4638                                  addr, addrv, dI );
4639                 break;
4640              }
4641              /* 32-bit float.  We can just use _store4, but need
4642                 to futz with the argument type. */
4643              case Ity_F32: {
4644                 IRAtom* i32 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I32, 
4645                                          unop(Iop_ReinterpF32asI32,
4646                                               data ) );
4647                 IRAtom* i64 = assignNew( 'I', pce, Ity_I64, 
4648                                          unop(Iop_32Uto64,
4649                                               i32 ) );
4650                 gen_dirty_v_WWW( pce,
4651                                  &check_store4,
4652                                  "check_store4",
4653                                  addr, addrv, i64 );
4654                 break;
4655              }
4656              default:
4657                 ppIRType(d_ty); tl_assert(0);
4658           }
4659        }
4660        /* And don't copy the original, since the helper does the store.
4661           Ick. */
4662        return True; /* store was successfully instrumented */
4663     }
4664     
4665     
4666     /* schemeS helper for doing loads, pulled out into a function because
4667        it needs to handle both normal loads and load-linked's.
4668     */
4669     static void schemeS_load ( PCEnv* pce, IRExpr* addr, IRType e_ty, IRTemp dstv )
4670     {
4671        HChar*  h_nm  = NULL;
4672        void*   h_fn  = NULL;
4673        IRExpr* addrv = NULL;
4674        if (e_ty == pce->gWordTy) {
4675           tl_assert(dstv != IRTemp_INVALID);
4676        } else {
4677           tl_assert(dstv == IRTemp_INVALID);
4678        }
4679        if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32) {
4680           /* 32 bit host/guest (cough, cough) */
4681           switch (e_ty) {
4682              /* Ity_I32: helper returns shadow value. */
4683              case Ity_I32:  h_fn = &check_load4_P;
4684                             h_nm = "check_load4_P"; break;
4685              /* all others: helper does not return a shadow
4686                 value. */
4687              case Ity_V128: h_fn = &check_load16;
4688                             h_nm = "check_load16"; break;
4689              case Ity_I64:
4690              case Ity_F64:  h_fn = &check_load8;
4691                             h_nm = "check_load8"; break;
4692              case Ity_F32:  h_fn = &check_load4;
4693                             h_nm = "check_load4"; break;
4694              case Ity_I16:  h_fn = &check_load2;
4695                             h_nm = "check_load2"; break;
4696              case Ity_I8:   h_fn = &check_load1;
4697                             h_nm = "check_load1"; break;
4698              default: ppIRType(e_ty); tl_assert(0);
4699           }
4700           addrv = schemeEw_Atom( pce, addr );
4701           if (e_ty == Ity_I32) {
4702              assign( 'I', pce, dstv, 
4703                       mkexpr( gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, h_fn, h_nm,
4704                                                    addr, addrv )) );
4705           } else {
4706              gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, NULL, h_fn, h_nm, addr, addrv );
4707           }
4708        } else {
4709           /* 64 bit host/guest (cough, cough) */
4710           switch (e_ty) {
4711              /* Ity_I64: helper returns shadow value. */
4712              case Ity_I64:  h_fn = &check_load8_P;
4713                             h_nm = "check_load8_P"; break;
4714              /* all others: helper does not return a shadow
4715                 value. */
4716              case Ity_V128: h_fn = &check_load16;
4717                             h_nm = "check_load16"; break;
4718              case Ity_F64:  h_fn = &check_load8;
4719                             h_nm = "check_load8"; break;
4720              case Ity_F32:
4721              case Ity_I32:  h_fn = &check_load4;
4722                             h_nm = "check_load4"; break;
4723              case Ity_I16:  h_fn = &check_load2;
4724                             h_nm = "check_load2"; break;
4725              case Ity_I8:   h_fn = &check_load1;
4726                             h_nm = "check_load1"; break;
4727              default: ppIRType(e_ty); tl_assert(0);
4728           }
4729           addrv = schemeEw_Atom( pce, addr );
4730           if (e_ty == Ity_I64) {
4731              assign( 'I', pce, dstv, 
4732                       mkexpr( gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, h_fn, h_nm,
4733                                                    addr, addrv )) );
4734           } else {
4735              gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, NULL, h_fn, h_nm, addr, addrv );
4736           }
4737        }
4738     }
4739     
4740     
4741     /* Generate into 'pce', instrumentation for 'st'.  Also copy 'st'
4742        itself into 'pce' (the caller does not do so).  This is somewhat
4743        complex and relies heavily on the assumption that the incoming IR
4744        is in flat form.
4745     
4746        Generally speaking, the instrumentation is placed after the
4747        original statement, so that results computed by the original can be
4748        used in the instrumentation.  However, that isn't safe for memory
4749        references, since we need the instrumentation (hence bounds check
4750        and potential error message) to happen before the reference itself,
4751        as the latter could cause a fault. */
4752     static void schemeS ( PCEnv* pce, IRStmt* st )
4753     {
4754        tl_assert(st);
4755        tl_assert(isFlatIRStmt(st));
4756     
4757        switch (st->tag) {
4758     
4759           case Ist_CAS: {
4760              /* In all these CAS cases, the did-we-succeed? comparison is
4761                 done using Iop_CasCmpEQ{8,16,32,64} rather than the plain
4762                 Iop_CmpEQ equivalents.  This isn't actually necessary,
4763                 since the generated IR is not going to be subsequently
4764                 instrumented by Memcheck.  But it's done for consistency.
4765                 See COMMENT_ON_CasCmpEQ in memcheck/mc_translate.c for
4766                 background/rationale. */
4767              IRCAS* cas = st->Ist.CAS.details;
4768              IRType elTy = typeOfIRExpr(pce->sb->tyenv, cas->expdLo);
4769              if (cas->oldHi == IRTemp_INVALID) {
4770                 /* ------------ SINGLE CAS ------------ */
4771                 /* -- single cas -- 32 bits, on 32-bit host -- */
4772                 /* -- single cas -- 64 bits, on 64-bit host -- */
4773                 /* -- viz, single cas, native-word case -- */
4774                 if ( (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32 && elTy == Ity_I32)
4775                      || (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I64 && elTy == Ity_I64) ) {
4776                    // 32 bit host translation scheme; 64-bit is analogous
4777                    // old#    = check_load4_P(addr, addr#)
4778                    // old     = CAS(addr:expd->new) [COPY]
4779                    // success = CasCmpEQ32(old,expd)
4780                    // if (success) do_shadow_store4_P(addr, new#)
4781                    IRTemp  success;
4782                    Bool    is64  = elTy == Ity_I64;
4783                    IROp    cmpEQ = is64 ? Iop_CasCmpEQ64 : Iop_CasCmpEQ32;
4784                    void*   r_fn  = is64 ? &check_load8_P  : &check_load4_P;
4785                    HChar*  r_nm  = is64 ? "check_load8_P" : "check_load4_P";
4786                    void*   w_fn  = is64 ? &do_shadow_store8_P  : &do_shadow_store4_P;
4787                    void*   w_nm  = is64 ? "do_shadow_store8_P" : "do_shadow_store4_P";
4788                    IRExpr* addr  = cas->addr;
4789                    IRExpr* addrV = schemeEw_Atom(pce, addr);
4790                    IRTemp  old   = cas->oldLo;
4791                    IRTemp  oldV  = newShadowTmp(pce, old);
4792                    IRExpr* nyu   = cas->dataLo;
4793                    IRExpr* nyuV  = schemeEw_Atom(pce, nyu);
4794                    IRExpr* expd  = cas->expdLo;
4795                    assign( 'I', pce, oldV, 
4796                            mkexpr( gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, r_fn, r_nm, addr, addrV )));
4797                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
4798                    success = newTemp(pce, Ity_I1, NonShad);
4799                    assign('I', pce, success, binop(cmpEQ, mkexpr(old), expd));
4800                    gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, mkexpr(success), w_fn, w_nm, addr, nyuV );
4801                 }
4802                 else
4803                 /* -- single cas -- 8 or 16 bits, on 32-bit host -- */
4804                 /* -- viz, single cas, 32-bit subword cases -- */
4805                 if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32
4806                     && (elTy == Ity_I8 || elTy == Ity_I16)) {
4807                    // 8-bit translation scheme; 16-bit is analogous
4808                    // check_load1(addr, addr#)
4809                    // old     = CAS(addr:expd->new) [COPY]
4810                    // success = CasCmpEQ8(old,expd)
4811                    // if (success) nonptr_or_unknown_range(addr, 1)
4812                    IRTemp  success;
4813                    Bool    is16  = elTy == Ity_I16;
4814                    IRExpr* addr  = cas->addr;
4815                    IRExpr* addrV = schemeEw_Atom(pce, addr);
4816                    IRTemp  old   = cas->oldLo;
4817                    IRExpr* expd  = cas->expdLo;
4818                    void*   h_fn  = is16 ? &check_load2  : &check_load1;
4819                    HChar*  h_nm  = is16 ? "check_load2" : "check_load1";
4820                    IROp    cmpEQ = is16 ? Iop_CasCmpEQ16 : Iop_CasCmpEQ8;
4821                    Int     szB   = is16 ? 2 : 1;
4822                    gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, NULL, h_fn, h_nm, addr, addrV );
4823                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
4824                    success = newTemp(pce, Ity_I1, NonShad);
4825                    assign('I', pce, success,
4826                                binop(cmpEQ, mkexpr(old), expd));
4827                    gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_range( pce, mkexpr(success),
4828                                                      addr, mkIRExpr_HWord(szB) );
4829                 }
4830                 else
4831                 /* -- single cas -- 8, 16 or 32 bits, on 64-bit host -- */
4832                 /* -- viz, single cas, 64-bit subword cases -- */
4833                 if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I64
4834                     && (elTy == Ity_I8 || elTy == Ity_I16 || elTy == Ity_I32)) {
4835                    // 8-bit translation scheme; 16/32-bit are analogous
4836                    // check_load1(addr, addr#)
4837                    // old     = CAS(addr:expd->new) [COPY]
4838                    // success = CasCmpEQ8(old,expd)
4839                    // if (success) nonptr_or_unknown_range(addr, 1)
4840                    IRTemp  success;
4841                    Bool    is16  = elTy == Ity_I16;
4842                    Bool    is32  = elTy == Ity_I32;
4843                    IRExpr* addr  = cas->addr;
4844                    IRExpr* addrV = schemeEw_Atom(pce, addr);
4845                    IRTemp  old   = cas->oldLo;
4846                    IRExpr* expd  = cas->expdLo;
4847                    void*   h_fn  = is32 ? &check_load4
4848                                         : (is16 ? &check_load2 : &check_load1);
4849                    HChar*  h_nm  = is32 ? "check_load4" 
4850                                         : (is16 ? "check_load2" : "check_load1");
4851                    IROp    cmpEQ = is32 ? Iop_CasCmpEQ32
4852                                         : (is16 ? Iop_CasCmpEQ16 : Iop_CasCmpEQ8);
4853                    Int     szB   = is32 ? 4 : (is16 ? 2 : 1);
4854                    gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, NULL, h_fn, h_nm, addr, addrV );
4855                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
4856                    success = newTemp(pce, Ity_I1, NonShad);
4857                    assign('I', pce, success,
4858                                binop(cmpEQ, mkexpr(old), expd));
4859                    gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_range( pce, mkexpr(success),
4860                                                      addr, mkIRExpr_HWord(szB) );
4861                 }
4862                 else
4863                    goto unhandled;
4864              } else {
4865                 /* ------------ DOUBLE CAS ------------ */
4866                 /* Punt on bigendian DCAS.  In fact it's probably trivial
4867                    to do; just swap the individual shadow loads/stores
4868                    around in memory, but we'd have to verify it, and there
4869                    is no use case.  So punt. */
4870                 if (cas->end != Iend_LE)
4871                    goto unhandled;
4872                 /* -- double cas -- 2 x 32 bits, on 32-bit host -- */
4873                 /* -- double cas -- 2 x 64 bits, on 64-bit host -- */
4874                 /* -- viz, double cas, native-word case -- */
4875                 if ( (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32 && elTy == Ity_I32)
4876                      || (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I64 && elTy == Ity_I64) ) {
4877                    // 32 bit host translation scheme; 64-bit is analogous
4878                    // oldHi#    = check_load4_P(addr+4, addr#)
4879                    // oldLo#    = check_load4_P(addr+0, addr#)
4880                    // oldHi/Lo  = DCAS(addr:expdHi/Lo->newHi/Lo) [COPY]
4881                    // success   = CasCmpEQ32(oldHi,expdHi) && CasCmpEQ32(oldLo,expdLo)
4882                    //           = ((oldHi ^ expdHi) | (oldLo ^ expdLo)) == 0
4883                    // if (success) do_shadow_store4_P(addr+4, newHi#)
4884                    // if (success) do_shadow_store4_P(addr+0, newLo#)
4885                    IRTemp  diffHi, diffLo, diff, success, addrpp;
4886                    Bool    is64       = elTy == Ity_I64;
4887                    void*   r_fn       = is64 ? &check_load8_P  : &check_load4_P;
4888                    HChar*  r_nm       = is64 ? "check_load8_P" : "check_load4_P";
4889                    void*   w_fn       = is64 ? &do_shadow_store8_P
4890                                              : &do_shadow_store4_P;
4891                    void*   w_nm       = is64 ? "do_shadow_store8_P"
4892                                              : "do_shadow_store4_P";
4893                    IROp    opADD      = is64 ? Iop_Add64 : Iop_Add32;
4894                    IROp    opXOR      = is64 ? Iop_Xor64 : Iop_Xor32;
4895                    IROp    opOR       = is64 ? Iop_Or64 : Iop_Or32;
4896                    IROp    opCasCmpEQ = is64 ? Iop_CasCmpEQ64 : Iop_CasCmpEQ32;
4897                    IRExpr* step       = is64 ? mkU64(8) : mkU32(4);
4898                    IRExpr* zero       = is64 ? mkU64(0) : mkU32(0);
4899                    IRExpr* addr       = cas->addr;
4900                    IRExpr* addrV      = schemeEw_Atom(pce, addr);
4901                    IRTemp  oldLo      = cas->oldLo;
4902                    IRTemp  oldLoV     = newShadowTmp(pce, oldLo);
4903                    IRTemp  oldHi      = cas->oldHi;
4904                    IRTemp  oldHiV     = newShadowTmp(pce, oldHi);
4905                    IRExpr* nyuLo      = cas->dataLo;
4906                    IRExpr* nyuLoV     = schemeEw_Atom(pce, nyuLo);
4907                    IRExpr* nyuHi      = cas->dataHi;
4908                    IRExpr* nyuHiV     = schemeEw_Atom(pce, nyuHi);
4909                    IRExpr* expdLo     = cas->expdLo;
4910                    IRExpr* expdHi     = cas->expdHi;
4911                    tl_assert(elTy == Ity_I32 || elTy == Ity_I64);
4912                    tl_assert(pce->gWordTy == elTy);
4913                    addrpp = newTemp(pce, elTy, NonShad);
4914                    assign('I', pce, addrpp, binop(opADD, addr, step));
4915                    assign('I', pce, oldHiV,
4916                           mkexpr( gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, r_fn, r_nm,
4917                                                        mkexpr(addrpp), addrV ))
4918                    );
4919                    assign('I', pce, oldLoV,
4920                           mkexpr( gen_dirty_W_WW( pce, r_fn, r_nm,
4921                                                        addr, addrV ))
4922                    );
4923                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
4924                    diffHi = newTemp(pce, elTy, NonShad);
4925                    assign('I', pce, diffHi,
4926                                binop(opXOR, mkexpr(oldHi), expdHi));
4927                    diffLo = newTemp(pce, elTy, NonShad);
4928                    assign('I', pce, diffLo,
4929                                binop(opXOR, mkexpr(oldLo), expdLo));
4930                    diff = newTemp(pce, elTy, NonShad);
4931                    assign('I', pce, diff,
4932                           binop(opOR, mkexpr(diffHi), mkexpr(diffLo)));
4933                    success = newTemp(pce, Ity_I1, NonShad);
4934                    assign('I', pce, success,
4935                           binop(opCasCmpEQ, mkexpr(diff), zero));
4936                    gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, mkexpr(success),
4937                                          w_fn, w_nm, mkexpr(addrpp), nyuHiV );
4938                    gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, mkexpr(success),
4939                                         w_fn, w_nm, addr, nyuLoV );
4940                 }
4941                 else
4942                 /* -- double cas -- 2 x 32 bits, on 64-bit host -- */
4943                 if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I64 && elTy == Ity_I32) {
4944                    // check_load8(addr, addr#)
4945                    // oldHi/Lo  = DCAS(addr:expdHi/Lo->newHi/Lo) [COPY]
4946                    // success   = CasCmpEQ32(oldHi,expdHi) && CasCmpEQ32(oldLo,expdLo)
4947                    //           = ((oldHi ^ expdHi) | (oldLo ^ expdLo)) == 0
4948                    // if (success) nonptr_or_unknown_range(addr, 8)
4949                    IRTemp  diffHi, diffLo, diff, success;
4950                    IRExpr* addr   = cas->addr;
4951                    IRExpr* addrV  = schemeEw_Atom(pce, addr);
4952                    IRTemp  oldLo  = cas->oldLo;
4953                    IRTemp  oldHi  = cas->oldHi;
4954                    IRExpr* expdLo = cas->expdLo;
4955                    IRExpr* expdHi = cas->expdHi;
4956                    gen_dirty_v_WW( pce, NULL, &check_load8, "check_load8",
4957                                    addr, addrV );
4958                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
4959                    diffHi = newTemp(pce, Ity_I32, NonShad);
4960                    assign('I', pce, diffHi,
4961                                binop(Iop_Xor32, mkexpr(oldHi), expdHi));
4962                    diffLo = newTemp(pce, Ity_I32, NonShad);
4963                    assign('I', pce, diffLo,
4964                                binop(Iop_Xor32, mkexpr(oldLo), expdLo));
4965                    diff = newTemp(pce, Ity_I32, NonShad);
4966                    assign('I', pce, diff,
4967                           binop(Iop_Or32, mkexpr(diffHi), mkexpr(diffLo)));
4968                    success = newTemp(pce, Ity_I1, NonShad);
4969                    assign('I', pce, success,
4970                           binop(Iop_CasCmpEQ32, mkexpr(diff), mkU32(0)));
4971                    gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_range( pce, mkexpr(success),
4972                                                      addr, mkU64(8) );
4973                 }
4974                 else
4975                    goto unhandled;
4976              }
4977              break;
4978           }
4979     
4980           case Ist_LLSC: {
4981              if (st->Ist.LLSC.storedata == NULL) {
4982                 /* LL */
4983                 IRTemp dst    = st->Ist.LLSC.result;
4984                 IRType dataTy = typeOfIRTemp(pce->sb->tyenv, dst);
4985                 Bool   isWord = dataTy == pce->gWordTy;
4986                 IRTemp dstv   = isWord ? newShadowTmp( pce, dst )
4987                                        : IRTemp_INVALID;
4988                 schemeS_load( pce, st->Ist.LLSC.addr, dataTy, dstv );
4989                 /* copy the original -- must happen after the helper call */
4990                 stmt( 'C', pce, st );
4991              } else {
4992                 /* SC */
4993                 schemeS_store( pce,
4994                                st->Ist.LLSC.storedata,
4995                                st->Ist.LLSC.addr,
4996                                st->Ist.LLSC.result );
4997                 /* Don't copy the original, since the helper does the
4998                    store itself. */
4999              }
5000              break;
5001           }
5002     
5003           case Ist_Dirty: {
5004              Int i;
5005              IRDirty* di;
5006              stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5007              /* nasty.  assumes that (1) all helpers are unconditional,
5008                 and (2) all outputs are non-ptr */
5009              di = st->Ist.Dirty.details;
5010              /* deal with the return tmp, if any */
5011              if (di->tmp != IRTemp_INVALID
5012                  && typeOfIRTemp(pce->sb->tyenv, di->tmp) == pce->gWordTy) {
5013                 /* di->tmp is shadowed.  Set it to NONPTR. */
5014                 IRTemp dstv = newShadowTmp( pce, di->tmp );
5015                 if (pce->gWordTy == Ity_I32) {
5016                   assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkU32( (UWord)NONPTR ));
5017                 } else {
5018                   assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkU64( (UWord)NONPTR ));
5019                 }
5020              }
5021              /* apply the nonptr_or_unknown technique to any parts of
5022                 the guest state that happen to get written */
5023              for (i = 0; i < di->nFxState; i++) {
5024                 IntRegInfo iii;
5025                 tl_assert(di->fxState[i].fx != Ifx_None);
5026                 if (di->fxState[i].fx == Ifx_Read)
5027                    continue; /* this bit is only read -- not interesting */
5028                 get_IntRegInfo( &iii, di->fxState[i].offset,
5029                                       di->fxState[i].size );
5030                 tl_assert(iii.n_offsets >= -1 
5031                           && iii.n_offsets <= N_INTREGINFO_OFFSETS);
5032                 /* Deal with 3 possible cases, same as with Ist_Put
5033                    elsewhere in this function. */
5034                 if (iii.n_offsets == -1) {
5035                    /* case (1): exact write of an integer register. */
5036                    IRAtom* a1
5037                       = assignNew( 'I', pce, pce->gWordTy, 
5038                                    IRExpr_Get( iii.offsets[i], pce->gWordTy ));
5039                    IRTemp a2 = gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w( pce, a1 );
5040                    stmt( 'I', pce, IRStmt_Put( iii.offsets[i] 
5041                                                   + pce->guest_state_sizeB,
5042                                                mkexpr(a2) ));
5043                 } else {
5044                    /* when == 0: case (3): no instrumentation needed */
5045                    /* when > 0: case (2) .. complex case.  Fish out the
5046                       stored value for the whole register, heave it
5047                       through nonptr_or_unknown, and use that as the new
5048                       shadow value. */
5049                    tl_assert(iii.n_offsets >= 0 
5050                              && iii.n_offsets <= N_INTREGINFO_OFFSETS);
5051                    gen_nonptr_or_unknown_for_III( pce, &iii );
5052                 }
5053              } /* for (i = 0; i < di->nFxState; i++) */
5054              /* finally, deal with memory outputs */
5055              if (di->mFx != Ifx_None) {
5056                 tl_assert(di->mAddr && isIRAtom(di->mAddr));
5057                 tl_assert(di->mSize > 0);
5058                 gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_range( pce, NULL, di->mAddr,
5059                                                   mkIRExpr_HWord(di->mSize));
5060              }
5061              break;
5062           }
5063     
5064           case Ist_NoOp:
5065              break;
5066     
5067           /* nothing interesting in these; just copy them through */
5068           case Ist_AbiHint:
5069           case Ist_MBE:
5070           case Ist_Exit:
5071           case Ist_IMark:
5072              stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5073              break;
5074     
5075           case Ist_PutI: {
5076              IRRegArray* descr = st->Ist.PutI.descr;
5077              stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5078              tl_assert(descr && descr->elemTy);
5079              if (is_integer_guest_reg_array(descr)) {
5080                 /* if this fails, is_integer_guest_reg_array is returning
5081                    bogus results */
5082                 tl_assert(descr->elemTy == pce->gWordTy);
5083                 stmt(
5084                    'I', pce,
5085                    IRStmt_PutI(
5086                       mkIRRegArray(descr->base + pce->guest_state_sizeB,
5087                                    descr->elemTy, descr->nElems),
5088                       st->Ist.PutI.ix,
5089                       st->Ist.PutI.bias,
5090                       schemeEw_Atom( pce, st->Ist.PutI.data)
5091                    )
5092                 );
5093              }
5094              break;
5095           }
5096     
5097           case Ist_Put: {
5098              /* PUT(offset) = atom */
5099              /* 3 cases:
5100                 1. It's a complete write of an integer register.  Get hold of
5101                    'atom's shadow value and write it in the shadow state.
5102                 2. It's a partial write of an integer register.  Let the write
5103                    happen, then fish out the complete register value and see if,
5104                    via range checking, consultation of tea leaves, etc, its
5105                    shadow value can be upgraded to anything useful.
5106                 3. It is none of the above.  Generate no instrumentation. */
5107              IntRegInfo iii;
5108              IRType     ty;
5109              stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5110              ty = typeOfIRExpr(pce->sb->tyenv, st->Ist.Put.data);
5111              get_IntRegInfo( &iii, st->Ist.Put.offset,
5112                              sizeofIRType(ty) );
5113              if (iii.n_offsets == -1) {
5114                 /* case (1): exact write of an integer register. */
5115                 tl_assert(ty == pce->gWordTy);
5116                 stmt( 'I', pce,
5117                            IRStmt_Put( st->Ist.Put.offset
5118                                           + pce->guest_state_sizeB,
5119                                        schemeEw_Atom( pce, st->Ist.Put.data)) );
5120              } else {
5121                 /* when == 0: case (3): no instrumentation needed */
5122                 /* when > 0: case (2) .. complex case.  Fish out the
5123                    stored value for the whole register, heave it through
5124                    nonptr_or_unknown, and use that as the new shadow
5125                    value. */
5126                 tl_assert(iii.n_offsets >= 0 
5127                           && iii.n_offsets <= N_INTREGINFO_OFFSETS);
5128                 gen_nonptr_or_unknown_for_III( pce, &iii );
5129              }
5130              break;
5131           } /* case Ist_Put */
5132     
5133           case Ist_Store: {
5134              Bool ok = schemeS_store( pce,
5135                                       st->Ist.Store.data,
5136                                       st->Ist.Store.addr,
5137                                       IRTemp_INVALID/*not a SC*/ );
5138              if (!ok) goto unhandled;
5139              /* Don't copy the original, since the helper does the store
5140                 itself. */
5141              break;
5142           }
5143     
5144           case Ist_WrTmp: {
5145              /* This is the only place we have to deal with the full
5146                 IRExpr range.  In all other places where an IRExpr could
5147                 appear, we in fact only get an atom (Iex_RdTmp or
5148                 Iex_Const). */
5149              IRExpr* e      = st->Ist.WrTmp.data;
5150              IRType  e_ty   = typeOfIRExpr( pce->sb->tyenv, e );
5151              Bool    isWord = e_ty == pce->gWordTy;
5152              IRTemp  dst    = st->Ist.WrTmp.tmp;
5153              IRTemp  dstv   = isWord ? newShadowTmp( pce, dst )
5154                                      : IRTemp_INVALID;
5155     
5156              switch (e->tag) {
5157     
5158                 case Iex_Const: {
5159                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5160                    if (isWord)
5161                       assign( 'I', pce, dstv, schemeEw_Atom( pce, e ) );
5162                    break;
5163                 }
5164     
5165                 case Iex_CCall: {
5166                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5167                    if (isWord)
5168                       assign( 'I', pce, dstv,
5169                               mkexpr( gen_call_nonptr_or_unknown_w( 
5170                                          pce, mkexpr(dst)))); 
5171                    break;
5172                 }
5173     
5174                 case Iex_Mux0X: {
5175                    /* Just steer the shadow values in the same way as the
5176                       originals. */
5177                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5178                    if (isWord)
5179                       assign( 'I', pce, dstv, 
5180                               IRExpr_Mux0X(
5181                                  e->Iex.Mux0X.cond,
5182                                  schemeEw_Atom( pce, e->Iex.Mux0X.expr0 ),
5183                                  schemeEw_Atom( pce, e->Iex.Mux0X.exprX ) ));
5184                    break;
5185                 }
5186     
5187                 case Iex_RdTmp: {
5188                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5189                    if (isWord)
5190                       assign( 'I', pce, dstv, schemeEw_Atom( pce, e ));
5191                    break;
5192                 }
5193     
5194                 case Iex_Load: {
5195                    schemeS_load( pce, e->Iex.Load.addr, e_ty, dstv );
5196                    /* copy the original -- must happen after the helper call */
5197                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5198                    break;
5199                 }
5200     
5201                 case Iex_GetI: {
5202                    IRRegArray* descr = e->Iex.GetI.descr;
5203                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5204                    tl_assert(descr && descr->elemTy);
5205                    if (is_integer_guest_reg_array(descr)) {
5206                       /* if this fails, is_integer_guest_reg_array is
5207                          returning bogus results */
5208                       tl_assert(isWord);
5209                       assign(
5210                          'I', pce, dstv,
5211                          IRExpr_GetI(
5212                             mkIRRegArray(descr->base + pce->guest_state_sizeB,
5213                                          descr->elemTy, descr->nElems),
5214                             e->Iex.GetI.ix,
5215                             e->Iex.GetI.bias
5216                          )
5217                       );
5218                    }
5219                    break;
5220                 }
5221     
5222                 case Iex_Get: {
5223                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5224                    if (isWord) {
5225                       /* guest-word-typed tmp assignment, so it will have a
5226                          shadow tmp, and we must make an assignment to
5227                          that */
5228                       if (is_integer_guest_reg(e->Iex.Get.offset,
5229                                                sizeofIRType(e->Iex.Get.ty))) {
5230                          assign( 'I', pce, dstv,
5231                                  IRExpr_Get( e->Iex.Get.offset 
5232                                                 + pce->guest_state_sizeB,
5233                                              e->Iex.Get.ty) );
5234                       } else {
5235                          if (pce->hWordTy == Ity_I32) {
5236                             assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkU32( (UWord)NONPTR ));
5237                          } else {
5238                            assign( 'I', pce, dstv, mkU64( (UWord)NONPTR ));
5239                          }
5240                       }
5241                    } else {
5242                       /* tmp isn't guest-word-typed, so isn't shadowed, so
5243                          generate no instrumentation */
5244                    }
5245                    break;
5246                 }
5247     
5248                 case Iex_Unop: {
5249                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5250                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Unop.arg));
5251                    if (isWord)
5252                       instrument_arithop( pce, dst, dstv, e->Iex.Unop.op,
5253                                           e->Iex.Unop.arg,
5254                                           NULL, NULL, NULL );
5255                    break;
5256                 }
5257     
5258                 case Iex_Binop: {
5259                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5260                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Binop.arg1));
5261                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Binop.arg2));
5262                    if (isWord)
5263                       instrument_arithop( pce, dst, dstv, e->Iex.Binop.op,
5264                                           e->Iex.Binop.arg1, e->Iex.Binop.arg2,
5265                                           NULL, NULL );
5266                    break;
5267                 }
5268     
5269                 case Iex_Triop: {
5270                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5271                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Triop.arg1));
5272                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Triop.arg2));
5273                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Triop.arg3));
5274                    if (isWord)
5275                       instrument_arithop( pce, dst, dstv, e->Iex.Triop.op,
5276                                           e->Iex.Triop.arg1, e->Iex.Triop.arg2,
5277                                           e->Iex.Triop.arg3, NULL );
5278                    break;
5279                 }
5280     
5281                 case Iex_Qop: {
5282                    stmt( 'C', pce, st );
5283                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Qop.arg1));
5284                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Qop.arg2));
5285                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Qop.arg3));
5286                    tl_assert(isIRAtom(e->Iex.Qop.arg4));
5287                    if (isWord)
5288                       instrument_arithop( pce, dst, dstv, e->Iex.Qop.op,
5289                                           e->Iex.Qop.arg1, e->Iex.Qop.arg2,
5290                                           e->Iex.Qop.arg3, e->Iex.Qop.arg4 );
5291                    break;
5292                 }
5293     
5294                 default:
5295                    goto unhandled;
5296              } /* switch (e->tag) */
5297     
5298              break;
5299     
5300           } /* case Ist_WrTmp */
5301     
5302           default:
5303           unhandled:
5304              ppIRStmt(st);
5305              tl_assert(0);
5306        }
5307     }
5308     
5309     
5310     static IRTemp for_sg__newIRTemp_cb ( IRType ty, void* opaque )
5311     {
5312        PCEnv* pce = (PCEnv*)opaque;
5313        return newTemp( pce, ty, NonShad );
5314     }
5315     
5316     
5317     IRSB* h_instrument ( VgCallbackClosure* closure,
5318                          IRSB* sbIn,
5319                          VexGuestLayout* layout,
5320                          VexGuestExtents* vge,
5321                          IRType gWordTy, IRType hWordTy )
5322     {
5323        Bool  verboze = 0||False;
5324        Int   i /*, j*/;
5325        PCEnv pce;
5326        struct _SGEnv* sgenv;
5327     
5328        if (gWordTy != hWordTy) {
5329           /* We don't currently support this case. */
5330           VG_(tool_panic)("host/guest word size mismatch");
5331        }
5332     
5333        /* Check we're not completely nuts */
5334        tl_assert(sizeof(UWord)  == sizeof(void*));
5335        tl_assert(sizeof(Word)   == sizeof(void*));
5336        tl_assert(sizeof(Addr)   == sizeof(void*));
5337        tl_assert(sizeof(ULong)  == 8);
5338        tl_assert(sizeof(Long)   == 8);
5339        tl_assert(sizeof(Addr64) == 8);
5340        tl_assert(sizeof(UInt)   == 4);
5341        tl_assert(sizeof(Int)    == 4);
5342     
5343        /* Set up the running environment.  Both .sb and .tmpMap are
5344           modified as we go along.  Note that tmps are added to both
5345           .sb->tyenv and .tmpMap together, so the valid index-set for
5346           those two arrays should always be identical. */
5347        VG_(memset)(&pce, 0, sizeof(pce));
5348        pce.sb                = deepCopyIRSBExceptStmts(sbIn);
5349        pce.trace             = verboze;
5350        pce.hWordTy           = hWordTy;
5351        pce.gWordTy           = gWordTy;
5352        pce.guest_state_sizeB = layout->total_sizeB;
5353     
5354        pce.qmpMap = VG_(newXA)( VG_(malloc), "pc.h_instrument.1", VG_(free),
5355                                 sizeof(TempMapEnt));
5356        for (i = 0; i < sbIn->tyenv->types_used; i++) {
5357           TempMapEnt ent;
5358           ent.kind   = NonShad;
5359           ent.shadow = IRTemp_INVALID;
5360           VG_(addToXA)( pce.qmpMap, &ent );
5361        }
5362        tl_assert( VG_(sizeXA)( pce.qmpMap ) == sbIn->tyenv->types_used );
5363     
5364        /* Also set up for the sg_ instrumenter.  See comments at the top
5365           of this instrumentation section for details.  The two parameters
5366           constitute a closure, which sg_ can use to correctly generate
5367           new IRTemps as needed. */
5368        sgenv = sg_instrument_init( for_sg__newIRTemp_cb,
5369                                    (void*)&pce );
5370     
5371        /* Stay sane.  These two should agree! */
5372        tl_assert(layout->total_sizeB == PC_SIZEOF_GUEST_STATE);
5373     
5374        /* Copy verbatim any IR preamble preceding the first IMark */
5375     
5376        i = 0;
5377        while (i < sbIn->stmts_used && sbIn->stmts[i]->tag != Ist_IMark) {
5378           IRStmt* st = sbIn->stmts[i];
5379           tl_assert(st);
5380           tl_assert(isFlatIRStmt(st));
5381           stmt( 'C', &pce, sbIn->stmts[i] );
5382           i++;
5383        }
5384     
5385        /* Nasty problem.  IR optimisation of the pre-instrumented IR may
5386           cause the IR following the preamble to contain references to IR
5387           temporaries defined in the preamble.  Because the preamble isn't
5388           instrumented, these temporaries don't have any shadows.
5389           Nevertheless uses of them following the preamble will cause
5390           memcheck to generate references to their shadows.  End effect is
5391           to cause IR sanity check failures, due to references to
5392           non-existent shadows.  This is only evident for the complex
5393           preambles used for function wrapping on TOC-afflicted platforms
5394           (ppc64-linux, ppc32-aix5, ppc64-aix5).
5395     
5396           The following loop therefore scans the preamble looking for
5397           assignments to temporaries.  For each one found it creates an
5398           assignment to the corresponding shadow temp, marking it as
5399           'defined'.  This is the same resulting IR as if the main
5400           instrumentation loop before had been applied to the statement
5401           'tmp = CONSTANT'.
5402        */
5403     #if 0
5404        // FIXME: this isn't exactly right; only needs to generate shadows
5405        // for guest-word-typed temps
5406        for (j = 0; j < i; j++) {
5407           if (sbIn->stmts[j]->tag == Ist_WrTmp) {
5408              /* findShadowTmpV checks its arg is an original tmp;
5409                 no need to assert that here. */
5410              IRTemp tmp_o = sbIn->stmts[j]->Ist.WrTmp.tmp;
5411              IRTemp tmp_s = findShadowTmp(&pce, tmp_o);
5412              IRType ty_s  = typeOfIRTemp(sbIn->tyenv, tmp_s);
5413              assign( 'V', &pce, tmp_s, definedOfType( ty_s ) );
5414              if (0) {
5415                 VG_(printf)("create shadow tmp for preamble tmp [%d] ty ", j);
5416                 ppIRType( ty_s );
5417                 VG_(printf)("\n");
5418              }
5419           }
5420        }
5421     #endif
5422     
5423        /* Iterate over the remaining stmts to generate instrumentation. */
5424     
5425        tl_assert(sbIn->stmts_used > 0);
5426        tl_assert(i >= 0);
5427        tl_assert(i < sbIn->stmts_used);
5428        tl_assert(sbIn->stmts[i]->tag == Ist_IMark);
5429     
5430        for (/*use current i*/; i < sbIn->stmts_used; i++) {
5431           /* generate sg_ instrumentation for this stmt */
5432           sg_instrument_IRStmt( sgenv, pce.sb, sbIn->stmts[i],
5433                                 layout, gWordTy, hWordTy );
5434           /* generate h_ instrumentation for this stmt */
5435           schemeS( &pce, sbIn->stmts[i] );
5436        }
5437     
5438        /* generate sg_ instrumentation for the final jump */
5439        sg_instrument_final_jump( sgenv, pce.sb, sbIn->next, sbIn->jumpkind,
5440                                  layout, gWordTy, hWordTy );
5441     
5442        /* and finalise .. */
5443        sg_instrument_fini( sgenv );
5444     
5445        /* If this fails, there's been some serious snafu with tmp management,
5446           that should be investigated. */
5447        tl_assert( VG_(sizeXA)( pce.qmpMap ) == pce.sb->tyenv->types_used );
5448        VG_(deleteXA)( pce.qmpMap );
5449     
5450        return pce.sb;
5451     }

5469     /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5470     /*--- Finalisation                                                 ---*/
5471     /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5472     
5473     void h_fini ( Int exitcode )
5474     {
5475        if (VG_(clo_verbosity) == 1 && !VG_(clo_xml)) {
5476           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, 
5477                        "For counts of detected and suppressed errors, "
5478                        "rerun with: -v\n");
5479        }
5480     
5481        if (VG_(clo_stats)) {
5482           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5483                        "  h_:  %'10llu client allocs, %'10llu client frees\n", 
5484                        stats__client_mallocs, stats__client_frees);
5485           VG_(message)(Vg_DebugMsg,
5486                        "  h_:  %'10llu Segs allocd,   %'10llu Segs recycled\n", 
5487                        stats__segs_allocd, stats__segs_recycled);
5488        }
5489     
5490     #if 0
5491        if (h_clo_lossage_check) {
5492           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "\n");
5493           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "%12lld total memory references\n",
5494                                    stats__tot_mem_refs);
5495           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "%12lld   of which are in a known segment\n",
5496                                    stats__refs_in_a_seg);
5497           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "%12lld   of which are 'lost' w.r.t the seg\n",
5498                                    stats__refs_lost_seg);
5499           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "\n");
5500           show_lossage();
5501           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "\n");
5502        } else {
5503           tl_assert( 0 == VG_(OSetGen_Size)(lossage) );
5504        }
5505     #endif
5506     }
